required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: New Mechatronic Device for Epidural Space Detection
clinical_study.official_title: A New Pressure Guided Mechatronic Tool for Epidural Space Detection: Feasibility Assessment in a Clinical Scenario

brief_summary.textblock: This study sought to perform the feasibility assessment of a new, non-invasive device for Loss of Resistance (LOR) detection in clinical settings. The device in charge is a mechatronic device optimized in its configurations in order to detect Loss of Resistance while performing epidural injections.

primary_outcome.description: A non invasive device to detect loss of resistance during epidural infiltration

clinical_study.condition: Non Invasive Monitoring of Loss of Resistance During Epidural Injection

arm_group.arm_group_label: Procedures with the use of device for LOR monitoring
arm_group.description: Patients enrolled suffered from chronic back pain and underwent epidural infiltration. The device is used.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Procedures without the use of device for LOR monitoring
arm_group.description: Patients enrolled suffered from chronic back pain and underwent epidural infiltration

intervention.description: The epidural technique is totally performed in a sterile field without any harm to the patient. The LOR measurement is monitored via the bespoke device used during the epidural procedure.
intervention.arm_group_label: Procedures with the use of device for LOR monitoring

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients whose pathology requires specific treatment such as epidural infiltration
Exclusion Criteria:
- coagulation abnormalities or assumption of anticoagulant drugs

reference.citation: Tesei M, Saccomandi P, Massaroni C, Quarta R, Carassiti M, Schena E, Setola R.
